text.0: may he who hath his home with strength the mighty the king supreme of earth and spacious heaven.
text.1: lord of true power to he invoked in battlesmay indra girt by maruts be our succour.
text.2: whose way is unattainable like sūryas he in each fight is the strong vṛtraslayer.
text.3: mightiest with his friends in his own courses may indra girt by maruts be our succour.
text.4: whose paths go forth in their great might resistless forthmilking as it were heavens genial moisture.
text.5: with manly strength triumphant foesubduermay indra girt by maruts be our succour.
text.6: among aṅgirases he was the chiefest a friend with friends mighty amid the mighty.
text.7: praiser mid praisers honoured most of singers may indra girt by maruts be our succour.
text.8: strong with the rudras as with his own children in manly battle conquering his foemen.
text.9: with his close comrades doing deeds of glorymay indra girt by maruts be our succour.
text.10: humbler of pride exciter of the conflict the lord of heroes god invoked of many.
text.11: may he this day gain with our men the sunlight may indra girt by maruts be our succour.
text.12: his help hath made him cheerer in the battle the folk have made him guardian of their comfort.
text.13: sole lord is he of every holy service may indra girt by maruts be our succour.
text.14: to him the hero on high days of prowess heroes for help and booty shall betake them.
text.15: he hath found light even in the blinding darkness may indra girt by maruts be our succour.
text.16: he with his left hand checketh even the mighty and with his right hand gathereth up the booty.
text.17: even with the humble he acquireth riches may indra girt by maruts be our succour.
text.18: with hosts on foot and cars he winneth treasures well is he known this day by all the people.
text.19: with manly might he conquereth those who hate him may indra girt by maruts be our succour.
text.20: when in his ways with kinsmen or with strangers he speedeth to the fight invoked of many.
text.21: for gain of waters and of sons and grandsons may indra girt by maruts be our succour.
text.22: awful and fierce fiendslayer thunderwielder with boundless knowledge hymned by hundreds mighty.
text.23: in strength like soma guard of the five peoples may indra girt by maruts be our succour.
text.24: winning the light hitherward roars his thunder like the terrific mighty voice of heaven.
text.25: rich gifts and treasures evermore attend him may indra girt by maruts be our succour.
text.26: whose home eternal through his strength surrounds him on every side his laud the earth and heaven.
text.27: may he delighted with our service save us may indra girt by maruts be our succour.
text.28: the limit of whose power not gods by godhead nor mortal men have reached nor yet the waters.
text.29: both earth and heaven in vigour he surpasseth may indra girt by maruts he our succour.
text.30: the red and tawny mare blazemarked high standing celestial who to bring Ṛjrāśva riches.
text.31: drew at the pole the chariot yoked with stallions joyous among the hosts of men was noted.
text.32: the vārṣāgiras unto thee o indra the mighty one sing forth this laud to please thee.
text.33: Ṛjrāśva with his fellows ambarīṣa surādhas sahadeva bhayamāna.
text.34: he much invoked hath slain dasyus and Śimyus after his wont and laid them low with arrows.
text.35: the mighty thunderer with his faircomplexioned friends won the land the sunlight and the waters.
text.36: may indra evermore be our protector and unimperilled may we win the booty.
text.37: this prayer of ours may varuṇa grant and mitra and aditi and sindhu earth and heaven.
